wikipedia_page.main: Charles Philip Oldfield Bartlett,  (3 January 1889 – February 1987) was a British flying ace of the First World War, credited with eight aerial victories in the course of flying bombing sorties against the Germans. He remained in service after the war, even though he struggled with health issues that threatened his forced resignation. He would serve until 1932, rising to the rank of squadron leader.

response: *Charles Bartlett (film director) (1888–?), American silent film director
*Charles Bartlett (RAF officer) (1889–1986), English World War I flying ace
*Charles Bartlett Johnson (born 1933), American businessman and billionaire
